alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:00AM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Areas of snow showers will continue to increase across the area this morning, with the most active and steadier snowfall occurring later this afternoon and evening. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 3 to 6 inches, with lesser amounts below 5000 feet and locally higher amounts above 7000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to near 40 mph at times, leading to areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...The Mogollon Rim, Coconino Plateau and the higher terrain of Yavapai County. Including Flagstaff, Doney Park, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard, Prescott, Seligman, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could led to very difficult travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. Hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Additional snow forecast through 11 PM this evening: Doney Park 2 to 4 inches Flagstaff 4 to 8 inches Forest Lakes 6 to 10 inches Heber-Overgaard 2 to 4 inches Prescott 3 to 5 inches Seligman 1 to 3 inches Valle 2 to 4 inches Williams 4 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains
